conclusion: Analyze motion of particles A and B to find acceleration ratio during acceleration phases.
Particle A accelerates from t = 0 to t = t₀, reaching velocity v = 2v₀. Particle B accelerates from t = 0 to t = 5t₀, reaching velocity v = v₀.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Calculate acceleration for particle A: a_A = (2v₀ - 0)/t₀ = 2v₀/t₀.
Calculate acceleration for particle B: a_B = (v₀ - 0)/(5t₀) = v₀/5t₀.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particle A to particle B during their acceleration phases is 10:1.
